findings.title: Collateral accumulation in CollateralShort contract
findings.description: The `_repayWithCollateral` function in `CollateralShort` contract did not burn the collateral used for repayment, resulting in users receiving more collateral than they should. This excess collateral could allow a malicious user to drain the underlying collateral from the contract.

findings.title: Excess collateral reception by users
findings.description: The `_repayWithCollateral` function did not burn the collateral used for repayment, resulting in users receiving more collateral than they should. This excess collateral could allow a malicious user to drain the underlying collateral from the contract.

findings.title: Malicious user draining underlying collateral from contract
findings.description: A malicious user could drain the underlying collateral from the contract by exploiting an issue in the `_repayWithCollateral` function where exchange fees were not properly calculated, resulting in users receiving more collateral than they should.

findings.title: Marginally undercalculated exchange fees
findings.description: The exchange fee was added to the expectedAmount received after exchange, resulting in the exchange fee being marginally undercalculated.
